title: Multimedia Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Galway (Galway)
Interview Descriptions: Easy. Phone call followed by zoom call. During lockdown so interview and job all online. Was a short contract so the interview was informal and swift. Enjoyed the interview process
Interview Questions: Is there anything you find daunting about this position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Galway in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: When doing your CV, make sure you list all your technical skills in a list, these will be critical to be selected for the next round of interview. For the face to face interview, you will need to prepare a presentation to show your previous research. Three interviewers will be present. Questions are related to previous research conducted and technical expertise.
Interview Questions:
Previous research conducted
How I faced ta difficult technical situation in the past

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Galway (Galway) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions:
i made an application online via the website and vacancies portal. 
I was then called for interview
there was 4 interviewers on the panel
each interviewer took a section
The interview  took approximately  1 hour from start to finish.
Interview Questions:
teaching strategies
research output
curriculum review process

title: Sr. Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Galway
Interview Descriptions: Proposal submission and review followed by an interview on skill set. The interview was online and very friendly. I got a positive reply within 2 weeks. Th offer letter arrived later after another two weeks with continuous communication for documentation required.
Interview Questions: Future plans, Loop holes in proposal and time line for finish

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Galway (Galway) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Emailed the professor of the lab my updated CV and cover letter. Upon review, I was called for one interview with a panel of 4 members after which I was offered the job.

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Galway
Interview Descriptions: Already had an established relationship with hiring manager and they were aware of my previous internship history. There was no formal interview for the position based on their knowledge of my work history and activities.
Interview Questions: What course was I pursuing currently

title: Placement Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Galway (Galway)
Interview Descriptions:
The interview was intimidating, even for someone very experienced like myself. The reason it was this way is because i was left waiting in a hallway for over 40 minutes - the only contact anybody made with me were some friendly folks passing by. 

When i was finally called for my presentation and interview,  i immediately felt like i wasn't welcome. I was rushed through everything, only one person on the panel seemed friendly and the others seemed like they were going through the motions. Somebody even mentioned that they were running into their lunchtime - message received.

The most unfair and upsetting element of this process was that my interview took 30 minutes - longer than i was sitting outside and clearly longer than the candidate before me. 

My presentation was great and i was well prepared, I have years of experience that i was not asked about clearly because the interviewers were hungry. 

I am not easily stressed by interviews.... this was a truly awful experience

I would never raise this directly with the university because i could never apply for a job there again if i went on record about this unprofessional interview.

Please treat people with respect, those being interviewed are trying to change their lives and work for a prestigious university.
Interview Questions: How i would secure placements for students and what methods i would use

title: Design and Manufacturing Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Galway (Galway) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was straight forward. A breif overview of background up to date was given. Then typical questions of experience and skills.  Further question where asked regarding skills related to the job. Finally, closing question from the candidate where expected

title: PhD Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Galway (Galway) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a virtual interview via skype asking general questions and some technical questions. I applied for Hardiman scholar and did not get the scholar but got another scholarship in the same university.
Interview Questions: General questions related to my research area in the masters and why I want to do the PhD from this specific university and country.

title: Clinical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Galway (Galway) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: applied online. Got mail and asked to attend interview. Prepared with general data available in  internet for the post of CRA.  Learned about research and GCP. Asked about GCP, data collection, monitoring , patient safety . Also on CV, past experience in the filed

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Galway (Galway) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Absolute joke on an interview. Flew 6000 miles to deliver a 20 min lecture to interview panel on subject that was preselected and not my subject area. Then a half an hour interview. Was in town several days. No tour of campus. No meal. No meet and greet. Just one hour of contact. Never even saw the department. Interviews had empty lunch plates and waste strewn across their table and one fell asleep. Only half my expenses reimbursed, and even they were several months late. Felt very disrespected. Job went to internal candidate, who, surprise surprise, was expert on topic I’d been asked to prepare lecture on. Went back to my home institution with incredibly bad perception of the department and university.
Interview Questions: How could you bring in the department money from industry.

title: Lecturer Below the Bar Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Galway
Interview Descriptions: They requested a 20 min presentation on a preselected topic related to the job interview with a Q&A session on the presentation, my research interests and general views on teaching and research
Interview Questions: where do you see the role of this school in the overall future of the university

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Galway (Galway) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Paper application including CV and cover letter. Formal interview by boss-to-be, other stakeholders, HR staff. Fair and thorough interview with questions from various stakeholders. Received notification of selection for interview and job offer in a timely fashion.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Galway (Galway) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Panel of 2. Usual chat about work experience and the like. Told them about education experience in the university and about my cell culture experience. Pretty low level position so not too much pressure.

title: Senior Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Galway (Galway) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Application by CV and interview form, interview held a few months later - comprising 8 senior staff and external independent reviewers - I had to give a presentation on a pre-set topic and interviewed immediately afterwards for approximately 40 minutes. I was asked a wide range of questions on all aspects of my employment history and goals. On comparing notes with other candidates afterwards, we were asked very similar questions in the same order.
Interview Questions: Hardest question was on my view of the current publishing policies of academic journals in my area

title: Archivist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Galway (Galway) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very structured, 5 people on the panel: Head librarian, Deputy head librarian, Sub-Librarian who manages the post, one academic and one external person.  No one from HR. The structure of the interview followed the job spec in the advert very closely.  A fairly straight forward effort to access your suitability for the job.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with a colleague not pulling their weight
